message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.SD, cs.HC 

This paper is about using active learning to optimize dialogue policies in spoken dialogue systems. It involves using machine learning techniques such as Gaussian processes and recurrent neural networks. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also involves reinforcement learning, which falls under the category of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The use of machine learning models such as Gaussian processes and recurrent neural networks suggests that the paper could also be classified under cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also involves human-computer interaction, which could place it under cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction). Finally, the paper involves spoken dialogue systems, which could place it under cs.SD (Sound).
